channel.title: One Third of -Like Stars have Earth-Sized Planets in Habitable Zone based on Kepler D
channel.description:
[quote="Facepunch"] [url=https://arxiv.org/PS_cache/arxiv/pdf/1109/1109.4682v1.pdf]Arxiv - Terrestrial, Habitable-Zone Exoplanet Frequency from Kepler (27 pages)[/url]
![](upload://ujDUoico3YfWkfkGN6d0tiwNTP.png)
The period and radius of Kepler planets in the sample, around bright stars, are plotted. The lower right corner is relatively empty, probably owing to low SNR there, not because small planets are absent from long periods. The upper left corner is relatively sparse, in spite of an expected high SNR there, implying a deficit of large planets on short-period orbits. The left side of the diagram is relatively empty owing to an apparent paucity of planets of all sizes at periods less than 3 days. The right side of the diagram is not completely sampled in the current database, so should be ignored here.
Source: [url]https://nextbigfuture.com/2011/09/one-third-of-sun-like-stars-have-earth.html[/url] [/quote] Fuck.
EDIT: Fuck.

item.dc:creator: Frozen_Cham
item.description:
Space is full of shit.
-light is a particle
-electron is a wave
-mass is an energy
-neutrino can exceed C
…now what?

I like the way it is.

Read full topic

item.title: One Third of -Like Stars have Earth-Sized Planets in Habitable Zone based on Kepler D
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
No shit. Civilization is multiplayer.

If you were to cut our quadrant of the galaxy out from the others that have life, though, it’d still be oversized. Would you then see that as a waste of space?

Read full topic
item.source: One Third of -Like Stars have Earth-Sized Planets in Habitable Zone based on Kepler D

item.title: One Third of -Like Stars have Earth-Sized Planets in Habitable Zone based on Kepler D
item.dc:creator: Dr_Perky
item.description:
Do you seriously believe that the universe was created just for humans.

Sure none of us will live to see the day when we do reach other planets. But the idea of no other intelligent life out there is ridiculous, unreasonable, and short-sighted thinking.

I’m putting simply in my original post. For there to be ONE planet out of all the universe with intelligent life is illogical thinking.

Read full topic
item.source: One Third of -Like Stars have Earth-Sized Planets in Habitable Zone based on Kepler D

item.title: One Third of -Like Stars have Earth-Sized Planets in Habitable Zone based on Kepler D
item.dc:creator: Comrade_Tiki
item.description:
TheeGoatPig:

That was as long as the sentence needed to be.

Except it’d have been totally inaccurate, and by being so wrong it’d have made what his actual statement is fictional. You see, I currently expect the level of intelligence it’d take to say something as mentally-deficient as what you suggest.

He was trying to get me to accept that some of you might be above that. By suggesting it in pragmatic language, accurate by ambiguity, he accomplished the elevation of my expectations (at least for him). But then you went ahead and validated my original opinion.

Fancy Pants:

tgp is stupid and a rapist

See, TGP?

Fancy Pants is practically the most honest person here. She’s so honest her hair’s like a litmus strip.

Dr. Perky:

If the earth was the only planet with life. Why would the universe be so big. It’d just be a waste of space.

It’s not a waste of space, it’s room for us to explore.

Unfortunately, you were born (and will die) during what is equivalent to the first 5 seconds of a Civilization game, so all that room will seem useless right now.

calhoun freeman:

This thread is now officially space core thread due to danielsangeo’s post count.

What does space have to do with this thread?

Oh! Right…

Read full topic
